title: The latest PBE changes allow me to give an example of what I don't get...
body:
You nerf a champion like Kassadin, who is barely played in solo queue and hovers at around 49% win rate.
ult range nerfed from 700 to 450

You nerf a champion like Vi, who is an extremely oppressive permaban champion, and has a click-to-kill solo-queue-perfect ult
5ms and 50 base damage nerf

Why such a large difference in nerf scale? Even though one obviously deserves more nerfs than the other??

Well that was also said about veigar and see where he is.Its double standards to say that Veig E is a point and click stun with no counterplay but Liss and to a leser extend vi have.Imo those champions are perfectly fine but hitting veigar(and gutting kass) so hard and talking bs about game health and counterplay is not

I don't think it was the stun itself as much as it was the play pattern - stun and burst from range with no chance of responding (against a good Veigar at least). Vi, and to a lesser extent, Lissandra both have to jump in to the middle of a fight for their stuns to work. I would still call Lissandra's iffy as it can be followed up by immediate burst, but it isn't the same.

They are both still very safe. Liss get's a zhonya's and an AOE Bind, and Vi gets to knock everyone back while ignoring all cc. Veigar got kassadin'd in comparison. His stun was his only defensive option he doesn't have low cd's on his q like lissandra does, and he certainly has damage like Vi, but lacks any tankyness. He lacks escapes of any kind and he really can't stick.
While that is true, there is still opportunity to respond to Vi and Lissandra. There wasn't to Veigar.

Well there was still an opportunity to respond to veigar, provided that you had the right items or summoners spells. For instance if you take cleanse or build QSS with an hourglass, you can easily negate his entire kit.

DID {{champion:7}} SOMEONE {{champion:51}} SAY {{champion:21}} POINT {{champion:117}} AND {{champion:127}} CLICK?

But seriously, she has one point-and-click in her ult, and she's hardly the only one who has that. The base damage is reasonable (compared to Lee Sin's), the range is reasonable (plenty of skillshot ults are global{{champion:222}} , and let's not even get into the champions who don't even have to aim their ult {{champion:30}}).

But do I think Vi needs a nerf? Hell yes. I play her, I love her kit and fighting style, but the jungle needs diversity and I'm willing to QQ and put up with heavier nerfs so that can happen. Do I think she's balanced? Yes, but the jungle isn't. The jungle caters way too much to AD bruisers (Fiddlesticks excels too, though). 

And Bard is the greatest thing to come to the League of Acrobatics.

Yeah, if Vi didn't have just a point-and-click playstyle I think she would be fairly balanced, maybe some damage reduction is all.

[Bard Icon] *Zhonya's for everyone*

You can see a stark difference between the strengths of Vi and Kass in competitive play when you look at the 4 major regions as a whole. 

Vi is mostly only played in NA, with occasional situational picks in China, she's almost completely unplayed in EU and Korea.

Kass on the other hand is considered a strong pick in NA, Pick/Ban in EU and a top mid lane in Korea and China.

While this says nothing about casual play Kass is far stronger competitively in every region except for NA.

Do you think I would be satisfied if Nature made my favorite fruit, let's say plums {{champion:45}} taste like shit overnight, and then announced that she is making watermelons {{champion:111}} (and co.) more delicious? Would that really make me forget about the plums? Hell no I want my plums back.  

And I know we're talking about a different plum here {{champion:38}} but really, range is such a delicate skill stat, seeing a whopping 40% range decrease on a melee champ is a HUGE non-rework change for a single patch.

Don't get me wrong, I'm glad that watermelons are going to taste better. They've tasted terrible for a while now, but... shit, man. My plums.

So that Kassadin WILL get close to 3k mana, use it as damage on his ulti wich is on a 2 sec CD max level is comparable to a 80 sec ulti that targets one guy and then locks it in place for a while and deals a hefty amount of damage? Not sure if trolling, but Kassadin can potentially ult 40 times during that timeframe, and will be able to cross the map several times and get several pentas worth of damage.

The big problem is, you can't compare a mobility ultimate with a CC ultimate. 

Let's compare Kassadin to some mobile champs' mobility abilities!

LB - 600 range, 10 sec CD, can dash back. Can copy with 24 sec CD ulti. 

Zed - 550 range, 14 sec CD, can dash to it.

Ezreal - 475 range, 11 sec CD, removes 1 sec for each Q he lands.

Rek'Sai - 250 range, 18 sec CD, has an internal CD of 12 sec per tunnel use on top of that. 

Lee Sin - (Q) 1100 range, 7 sec CD, skillshot, after that hits he can jump with 1300 range. (W) 700 range, 14 sec CD, can only be used on allied ward, minion or champion. 

Yasuo - 475 range (completes the 475 range dash even if enemy is 1 unit away) 0.1 sec CD, but can't be cast twice on an enemy for 6 seconds. Can only be used on enemy champs/minions.

Kalista - Dash pretty similar to Grave's Quickdraw, so around 400 range. Once every auto. Extra range while used backwars. Gets lower with AS debuffs (FH, Randuins)

Lissandra - 1050 range, 11 sec CD, if CC'd she can't teleport. 

Now how is Kassadin compared to these? 

K vs. LB - He dashes 5 times.

K vs. Zed - He dashes 7 times.

K vs. Ezreal - He dashes 5 times.

K vs. Rek'Sai - He dashes 9 times.

K vs. Lee Sin - He dashes 3 times (Q) and 7 times (W)

K vs. Yasuo - Completely situational.

K vs. Kalista - 1v1 dies most likely because no hard CC (learn that champs without hard CC SHOULD NOT be able to 1v1 Kalista) 

K vs. Lissandra - He dashes 5 times.

In most cases, he outranges the opponent by FAR. The only two who are a bit weird to analyze are Kassadin vs. Yas/Kalista since their mobility needs more than just point and click into the air.

So even if Kassadin got "gutted", he is still able to outblink the mobility creep champions. There is no counter-argument to these facts, honestly.

And don't compare Vi ulti and Kassadin ulti, it's like comparing Lee Sin's ulti with Singed's ulti, or something completely un-related.

> So that Kassadin WILL get close to 3k mana, use it as damage on his ulti wich is on a 2 sec CD

Yeah, you accidentally forget to mention that he scales off 2% maximum mana (or 6% if he's expending 960 for a blink), so 3k mana = 60 damage (or 180 at a cost of 960 mana). WOW SUCH DAMAGE KASSA DESTROYED ME WITH 60 DAMAGE HE INSTA-BURSTED SION.
You also forget than some Kassadin's don't buy Archangel (I usually see just RoA at LCS, so he get's ~1.8k mana late game which means 36 damage, but still).

> Let's compare Kassadin to some mobile champs' mobility abilities!

Again, you "accidentally" forget to mention Nidalee. btw you call "dash" to Kassadin's R when it's a "blink".

* Also, you forgot to mention that LeBlanc, for example, has three times the damage that Kassadin has (Kassa has ~500 +2 AP while LeBlanc has ~1,500 +3 AP).
* Against Zed you forgot that Zed's shadows represent a huge danger for 5 seconds and are a powerful zoning tool, also forgetting he can gap-close with his R and then teleport back with global range.
* Ezreal is an ADC and thus he deals far more damage and has far more range.
* Lee Sin doesn't even use mana ffs. He brings ton of CC, a higher burst than Kassa early game... either way, you can't compare them, they have completely different purposes.
* Yasuo I agree it's situational, but again, you can't compare them.
* Kalista can outran Udyr (who has hard CC) and once she gets slightly ahead, she becomes unkillable for every melee in the game.
* Lissandra is a short-range mage with good CC and sustained damage.

> In most cases, he outranges the opponent by FAR.

You "accidentally" (three times in a row, wow) forgot, AGAIN, Kassadin's mana costs. I will literally copy your ridiculous comparisons but add some mana costs:

* K vs. LB - He dashes 5 times. [LeBlanc can, in fact, dash 4 times within a single Kassa's dash, but you "accidentally" forgot to mention that] (At a cost of 1,860 mana)
* K vs. Zed - He dashes 7 times. (At a cost of 3,820 mana)
* K vs. Ezreal - He dashes 5 times. (At a cost of 1,820 mana)
* K vs. Rek'Sai - He dashes 9 times. [Rek'Sai leaves tunnels, she can theoretically dash 10 times in a row just from tunnels] (At a cost of 5,870 mana)
* K vs. Lee Sin - He dashes 3 times (Q, at a cost of 420 mana) and 7 times (W, At a cost of 3,820 mana) [Lee Sin can combine Q and W for a maximum of 2,000 range dash at a 14 (or 7 if he used W on a champion) second cooldown]
* K vs. Yasuo - Completely situational (At a cost of situational mana I guess)
* K vs. Kalista - 1v1 dies most likely because no hard CC [Kalista can reach 2.5 dashes per second (or ~5 within a single Kassa's Riftlimp), she won't build 2.5 speed, but at 2 speed she would dash 4 times for every Kassa's Riftlimp] (learn that champs without hard CC SHOULD NOT be able to 1v1 Kalista -> Ignoring the fact that Kassadin should be able to insta-burst Kalista.)
* K vs. Lissandra - He dashes 5 times. (At a cost of 1,860 mana)

> There is no counter-argument to these facts, honestly.

Yes, there are counter-arguments to these facts, but you ~~blatantly~~ accidentally ignored them. You are highly biased against Kassadin and you "accidentally" forgot to mention a lot of facts that give some context to Kassa's Riftlimp. Like the fact that he has a weaker burst than Nami (literally speaking, the only reason he out-burst Nami late game is because he has damage items while Nami has not, but a Nami with exactly the same build than Kassa would out-burst him).

> K vs. Rek'Sai - He dashes 9 times.
SHE*

As I expected, you have no idea what are you talking about so you will say "your counterarguments are ridiculous" for no reason instead of actually counter-arguing. Pathetic.

Again, immobile mages just can't do nothing against these ganks.
